lead_paragraph: FINBERG--Laurence, M.D.,leader in Pediatrics, dies at 92. Born May 20, 1923 and died January 22, 2016. A Chicago, IL native, Dr. Finberg earned his M.D. at the University of Chicago (1946) and launched his career in academic pediatrics on faculty at Johns Hopkins University School Of Medicine (1951-1963). An excellent researcher and valued teacher, Dr. Finberg became a pioneer and expert in fluids and electrolytes. His work led to seminal approaches for treating severe dehydration, malnutrition and other conditions in children. Professor & Chairman of Pediatrics at Albert Einstein College Of Medicine and Montefiore Medical Center (1963-1982) he later became Professor & Chairman of Pediatrics (1982-1994) and Dean of the School of Medicine (1988-1991) at SUNY Downstate Medical Center, Brooklyn, NY. When retired he taught at both University of California, San Francisco and Stanford University School Of Medicine. His leadership at Downstate and Kings County Hospital produced a thriving and nationally respected Department proudly serving Brooklyn's disadvantaged communities. With great respect and fond remembrance, the SUNY Downstate Department of Pediatrics mourns the loss of Dr. Finberg, an extraordinary leader, devoted pediatrician, gifted clinician, educator and internationally respected researcher. Through his knowledge, wisdom, integrity, teaching and lasting influence on generations of pediatricians, Dr. Finberg made a real difference and improved the lives and health of countless children worldwide. 1/3
